Albania: Alia became Chairman of the Presidium of the People's Assembly.
Argentina: Leader General Leopoldo Galtieri sent troops to the Falkland Islands triggering Falklands War; British task force retook islands by mid-June
Australia:
12th Commonwealth Games held in Brisbane.
The National Gallery of Australia is opened.
Bangladesh:
Lieutenant General Hussain Muhammad Ershad assumes power after a bloodless coup.
Bangladesh signs a memorandum of understanding with India on water sharing over the following two years.
Bhutan: The Royal Government establishes the Royal Monetary Authority, the central bank of Bhutan.
Canada: Canada achieves total independence from Great Britain through Patriation of its Constitution with the enactment of the Constitution Act, 1982 (which includes the Charter of Rights and Freedoms), by royal proclamation. The Government of Quebec refuses to sign the deal and attempts to veto the Act; the Supreme Court of Canada rules that Quebec's assent is not required.
Chile: Chile provides non-combat support for British armed forces during the Falkland War.
Colombia:
Belisario Betancur is elected president of Colombia
Paramilitary group "Muerte a Secuestradores" (MAS) is formed
Antioquian entrepreneur Felix Correa and his bank FURATENA get convicted for financial fraud causing a collapse in the national financial system
Mother Teresa visits Colombia
Gabriel García Márquez wins the Nobel Prize in literature
Colombia resigns as host for the 1986 FIFA World Cup due to scarcity of public resources
England: The Mary Rose is raised from the seabed of the Solent, where she had sunk in 1545.
Germany:
Germany wins the Eurovision Song Contest 1982, marking their first win by Nicole with 'Ein Bißchen Frieden'
Helmut Kohl of the CDU became chancellor of West Germany.
Indinesia: The height of Petrus ('mysterious shootings') of thousands of suspected criminals by government security forces. (to 1983)
Israel: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) forcibly evacuated Yamit per the terms of the Egypt–Israel Peace Treaty. Shlomo Argov, the Israeli ambassador to the United Kingdom, was shot in the head in London in an attempted assassination organized by Iraq's Iraqi Intelligence Service and carried out by the Palestinian nationalist Abu Nidal Organization. 1982 Lebanon War: The IDF invaded southern Lebanon in response to repeated attacks by the Palestinian nationalist Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), whose militants were sheltered there, on Israeli civilians.
Italy: Parliament approves law on "collaborators of justice". It was officially created the figure of Pentito. Roberto Calvi was found hanged in London. The Italian national football team wins its third FIFA World Cup in Spain. General Carlo Alberto Dalla Chiesa and his wife are killed by the mafia in Palermo.
Mexico: President José López Portillo nationalizes the banking industry.
Philippine: Reform the Armed Forces Movement (RAM) formed Sportsman Tomas Manotoc is abducted and "rescued" by the government agents. International Film Festival is held in the Manila Film Center. At least 38 deaths resulted when Typhoon Nelson tore through the central and southern areas of the country. United Nationalist Democratic Opposition formed. Barangay elections held for the first time. Felixberto Olalia and Crispin Beltran of the KMU are ordered to be arrested. Alleged Marcos' fake medals exposed. Pres. Marcos visits United States. Newspapers We Forum and Malaya are shut down by the President for engaging in "black propaganda."
Russia:
Suslov died after a severe stroke.
Brezhnev died of a heart attack.
Yuri Andropov was elected General Secretary of the CPSU.
Singapore: Singapore change its time zone to UTC+08:00. The Civil Defence Programme are launched.
Syria: A Muslim Brotherhood uprising in Hama was suppressed by the military.
Vietnam:
Trường Chinh, Chairman of the State Council (1981–1987) became ruler of Vietnam.
Fifth National Party Congress.
